trans-unit.source: Upgrade to the latest elastic database client library
trans-unit.target: Upgrade to the latest elastic database client library

trans-unit.source: New versions of the elastic database client library are available through [NuGet](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Client/) and the NuGetPackage Manager interface in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: New versions of the elastic database client library are available through [NuGet](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Client/) and the NuGetPackage Manager interface in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Upgrades contain bug fixes and support for new capabilities of the client library.
trans-unit.target: Upgrades contain bug fixes and support for new capabilities of the client library.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade steps
trans-unit.target: Upgrade steps

trans-unit.source: Upgrading requires you to rebuild your application with the new library, as well as change your existing Shard Map Manager metadata stored in your Azure SQL Databases to support new features.
trans-unit.target: Upgrading requires you to rebuild your application with the new library, as well as change your existing Shard Map Manager metadata stored in your Azure SQL Databases to support new features.

trans-unit.source: Follow the sequence below to upgrade your applications, the Shard Map Manager database, and the local Shard Map Manager metadata on each shard.
trans-unit.target: Follow the sequence below to upgrade your applications, the Shard Map Manager database, and the local Shard Map Manager metadata on each shard.

trans-unit.source: Performing upgrade steps in this order ensures that old versions of the client library are no longer present in your environment when metadata objects are updated, which means that old-version metadata objects won’t be created after upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Performing upgrade steps in this order ensures that old versions of the client library are no longer present in your environment when metadata objects are updated, which means that old-version metadata objects won’t be created after upgrade.

trans-unit.source: 1. Upgrade your applications.
trans-unit.target: 1. Upgrade your applications.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, download and reference the latest client library version into all of your development projects that use the library; then rebuild and deploy.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, download and reference the latest client library version into all of your development projects that use the library; then rebuild and deploy.

trans-unit.source: In your Visual Studio solution, select **Tools** --> **NuGet Package Manager** --> **Manage NuGet Packages for Solution**.
trans-unit.target: In your Visual Studio solution, select **Tools** --> **NuGet Package Manager** --> **Manage NuGet Packages for Solution**.

trans-unit.source: In the left panel, select **Updates**, and then select the **Update** button on the package **Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale Client Library** that appears in the window.
trans-unit.target: In the left panel, select **Updates**, and then select the **Update** button on the package **Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale Client Library** that appears in the window.

trans-unit.source: ![Upgrade Nuget Pacakges][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Upgrade Nuget Pacakges][1]

trans-unit.source: Build and Deploy.
trans-unit.target: Build and Deploy.

trans-unit.source: 2. Upgrade your scripts.
trans-unit.target: 2. Upgrade your scripts.

trans-unit.source: If you are using **PowerShell** scripts to manage shards, [download the new library version](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Client/) and copy it into the directory from which you execute scripts.
trans-unit.target: If you are using **PowerShell** scripts to manage shards, [download the new library version](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Client/) and copy it into the directory from which you execute scripts.

trans-unit.source: 3. Upgrade your split-merge service.
trans-unit.target: 3. Upgrade your split-merge service.

trans-unit.source: If you use the elastic database split-merge tool to reorganize sharded data, [download and deploy the latest version of the tool](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Service.SplitMerge/).
trans-unit.target: If you use the elastic database split-merge tool to reorganize sharded data, [download and deploy the latest version of the tool](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Service.SplitMerge/).

trans-unit.source: Detailed upgrade steps for the Service can be found [here](sql-database-elastic-scale-overview-split-and-merge.md).
trans-unit.target: Detailed upgrade steps for the Service can be found [here](sql-database-elastic-scale-overview-split-and-merge.md).

trans-unit.source: **4. Upgrade your Shard Map Manager DBs**.
trans-unit.target: **4. Upgrade your Shard Map Manager DBs**.

trans-unit.target: Upgrade the metadata supporting your Shard Maps in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.target: There are two ways you can accomplish this, using PowerShell or C#.

trans-unit.source: These techniques for metadata upgrades can be applied multiple times without harm.
trans-unit.target: These techniques for metadata upgrades can be applied multiple times without harm.

trans-unit.source: For example, if an older client version inadvertently creates a shard after you have already updated, you can run upgrade again across all shards to ensure that the latest metadata version is present throughout your infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: For example, if an older client version inadvertently creates a shard after you have already updated, you can run upgrade again across all shards to ensure that the latest metadata version is present throughout your infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** New versions of the client library published to-date continue to work with prior versions of the Shard Map Manager metadata on Azure SQL DB, and vice-versa.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** New versions of the client library published to-date continue to work with prior versions of the Shard Map Manager metadata on Azure SQL DB, and vice-versa.

trans-unit.source: However to take advantage of some of the new features in the latest client, metadata needs to be upgraded.
trans-unit.target: However to take advantage of some of the new features in the latest client, metadata needs to be upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Note that metadata upgrades will not affect any user-data or application-specific data, only objects created and used by the Shard Map Manager.
trans-unit.target: Note that metadata upgrades will not affect any user-data or application-specific data, only objects created and used by the Shard Map Manager.
